reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Provision of Life Saving Basic Medical and Sexual and Reproductive Health Care Services to conflicted affected Displaced and Local Population in Hard-to Reach Areas of 3 townships in Kachin

description.narrative: The project improving humanitarian health access to conflict affected communities in Kachin aims to contribute to reducing maternal mortality. The overall goal of the project is to contribute to reducing maternal morbidity in Kachin states and improving accessibility of reproductive health care as set out by Myanmar human response plan 2017. Key Objectives of project are to: 1. Improve access to health care services including for those women, men, boys and girls, including the most vulnerable and marginalized people, newly affected by disaster and other emergencies 2. To reduce unmet need for contraception, unplanned births in the access to and use of contraception. 3. To develop human resource capacity to satisfy unmet reproductive health needs and expertise. Access to health facilities and skilled health workers is lowest in difficult-to-reach border areas. Inter-communal conflicts in and armed conflict in Kachin have exacerbated the difficulty these populations face in accessing basic health services, including maternal child health and family planning services. This conflict has particularly impacted on women, girls and children who have witnessed violence, experienced interruption to education and poor health care services, including reproductive health. Conflict affected people have minimal resources and required safe drinking water, food, non-food items, shelter, and health care. Both men and women have a lack of awareness about reproductive health and there is poor support for lactating women and newborn babies. There are insufficient RH facilities and further RH support is required within targeted areas. UNFPA in collaboration with MMA will work closely with key stakeholders to strengthen the coordination, mobilization and management of RH services in order to improve effectiveness and efficiency of the health system. The programme will support humanitarian action assistance 44 IDP camps and 40 hard to reach villages within 3 Townships in Kachin state (14,953 Camp population and 54,628 from Host communities).

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
